Experience Manufacturing Supervisor Intel Corporation January 2005  – Present (10 years 8 months) Albuquerque, New Mexico Area Responsible for the safe efficient management of a team of 25+ highly skilled manufacturing technicians. The responsibilities of this role included performance management of employees, team development and motivation, and facilitating the capability of the team to achieve clearly set goals. In addition to the management of the team this role also required a solid capability in areas of product management, factory performance monitoring and execution to achieve shiftily, daily and weekly performance metrics. Retention Bake/Shipping Logistics /Backend Integration Engineer Intel Corporation January 2001  –  January 2005  (4 years 1 month) Albuquerque, New Mexico Area Engineering owner for the Retention Bake toolset. This tool utilized Staubli Robotics and Blue-M ovens in a controlled environment. Owned the installation and qualification for production of this tool. Led the manufacturing team in analytical problem solving for hard tool downs and root cause resolution of tool issues. Teamed with factory partners to address quality issues related to the bake area and finding and implementing innovative solutions both in the local factory and with international factory partners.  
 
Shipping Logistics Capability engineer responsible for accurate data transfer to minimize transportation losses and shipping to multiple international assembly facilities. Led team of international sites to develop tool capability, reliability improvements and ensure standardization at all sites. Resolved complex data management issues using various automation systems such as crystal ball, Business Logistic Shipping and others. Removed the need for manual “inking” of wafers to electronic transfer capabilities to all international sites.  
 
In addition, improving the process flows for the areas, developing S.O.P’s, creating, revising and delivering training materials while ensuring safety and ergonomic were top priority. Partnering with product engineering, test engineering, automation, planning and assembly test to validate new product introductions and ensure outgoing quality while meeting output goals. 
 Training Focus Group Leader Intel Corporation January 2000  –  January 2001  (1 year 1 month) Albuquerque, New Mexico Area Led the Training Focus Group for Sort. Responsible for designing and developing training materials; delivering human performance interventions and managing projects such as new process/product introductions, new software systems, and process tool training. Ownership for the progress of operations, equipment and process training to ensure future capabilities are met. This was achieved through partnership with manufacturing and engineering groups to identify gaps, determine requirements and implement roadmaps. Dedicated Training Specialist Intel Corporation January 1995  –  January 2001  (6 years 1 month) Albuquerque, New Mexico Area Provided skilled training to manufacturing technicians and others as needed.

Summary PROFILE 
 
Performance-driven Operations and Supply Chain Manager. More than 15 years of experience leading and managing people, projects, and enterprise operations with a track record of problem solving, driving change and realizing results. Skilled in business, manufacturing, engineering, and supply chain operations management at domestic and international facilities. Technical comprehension and strong interpersonal skills have enabled success across diverse cultures and business environments. Recognized for ability to facilitate and direct cross-department collaboration to realize organizational objectives. Stabilized and optimized operations through lean six sigma principles. Improved productivity and profitability by controlling costs, implementing lean manufacturing principles, and strategically growing business operations. MS / BS in Industrial Administration, APICS certified in Production and Inventory Management (CPIM), Lean Enterprise Certified Practitioner, Six Sigma Blackbelt certification in progress.  
 
LEADERSHIP COMPETENCIES: 
•	Supply Chain Operations Management, Scheduling and Planning 
•	Procurement, Supplier Development, Contract Negotiations, Strategic Sourcing Decisions 
•	Strategic Planning, Forecasting and Demand Management 
•	Distribution, Transportation and Inventory Management, Inventory Control, Cycle Counting 
•	Sales and Operations Planning 
•	P&L Management / Improvement 
•	Lean Manufacturing and Continuous Process Improvement 
•	Capacity Planning 
•	Engineering and Technical Management 
•	Coaching and Team Building ; Engaging to Plan, Develop, Check, and Act on plans  
•	Safety Management 
•	IS09001 / AS9100 Internal Audit 
•	Management by Goals, Metrics and KPIs
